info.title: Instructions
info.usage: Tokens reset every month. To reduce token consumption, you can choose a free language model or clear the conversation each time you change the topic.
info.acceptDisclaimer: I have read and understood these instructions

chat.start: Start the conversation by sending a message...
chat.systemMessageInfo: Initialize the conversation by giving high level instructions to the AI
chat.exampleSystemMessage: e.g. You are a helpful assistant
chat.denySave: The conversation may not be saved.
chat.toBeSaved: The discussion will be saved anonymously
chat.emptyConfirm: Are you sure you want to empty this conversation?
chat.testUseInfo: The new chat view is still in development and bugs are likely to occur
chat.confirmResetChat: Are you sure you want to empty this conversation?
chat.errorInstructions: Generating a response failed. We recommended saving the current conversation and starting a new one. You can also try another model. If the problem persists, please contact support.
chat.emptyReminder: Please note that long conversations consume more tokens. We recommend that you clear the conversation whenever you change the topic of the conversation.
chat.email: The conversation will be sent to {{email}}
chat.cancelResponse: Cancel the generation of the response
chat.warning: The new chat view is experiencing problems and the response generation is very slow. The old chat view is working normally.
chat.confirmResetMessage: You are about to start a new conversation and the ongoing conversation will be cleared.

settings.promptInstructions: The prompt refers to general guidelines for the conversation. For example, the language model can be asked to use academic language or to act as a gardener being interviewed about cactus care.
settings.temperatureInstructions: Higher values, like 0.8, make the output more random, while lower values, like 0.2, make it more accurate and deterministic.
settings.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset to default settings?
settings.confirmDeletePrompt: Are you sure you want to delete the prompt '{{name}}'?
settings.sourceDescription: Materials specified by the teacher can be used as a source in the course chat. You can select the source below.
settings.confirmClearCustomPrompt:
Warning: This action will clear your custom prompt: 
"{{customSystemMessage}}"
settings.newConversationToggle: Don't ask for confirmation for new conversations in the future.
settings.sidebarSettings: Keep the sidebar closed by default.

course.isReseachCourse: The course is a research course
course.canOptOut: It is not possible to opt out from saving the discussions
course.howToActive: Go to Courses I teach to activate the chat
course.curreEnabled: CurreChat is enabled for the course
course.curreNotEnabled: CurreChat is not enabled for the course
course.curreNotOpen: Students cannot access the chat of this course
course.curreOpen: The course chat is open for students
course.curreWasOpen: The course chat has been closed
course.curreWillBeOpen: The course chat will be open for students
course.enableCurreModalText: The course will by default use {{defaultModel}} and have a token usage limit of {{defaultTokenLimit}} per student. CurreChat will be available between {{activityPeriod}} (course running time + 1 month). You can edit these settings later.
course.closeToMaxTokenLimit: Students close to the token limit
course.averageTokenUsage: Average token usage by total usage
course.usagePercentage: Percentage of students who have used CurreChat
course.usageToolTip: Number of tokens consumed since the start of the course or since the last reset. Resets to zero when refreshed.
course.totalUsageToolTip: Total tokens consumed over the lifetime of the course. This value never resets.
course.isSavedOptOut: The course discussions will be saved anonymously, if you grant permission to save. Saved discussions can be used for research purposes.
course.isSavedNotOptOut:
The course discussions will be saved anonymously.

Saved discussions can be used for research purposes
course.isSavedForTeacherOptOut: The course discussions will be saved anonymously, if user grants the permission to save. Saved discussions can be used for research purposes

course.copyDirectPromptLinkInfo: Copy a link to chat with the prompt '{{name}}' active
course.name: Name

prompt.defaultRagMessage: If the user refers to source materials or mentions 'materials', use the document_search tool to retrieve information from the sources. Incorporate the results into your answer.
prompt.enforceRagMessage: All answers must be based on the source materials. Always use the document_search tool and do not add information that is not found in the sources.
prompt.unknownRagMessage: If the answer cannot be found in the source materials, tell the user directly that no answer is available from the sources.

feedback.title: Give feedback about CurreChat to the developers
feedback.description: Noticed something we should improve? Or have a feature suggestion? Tell us about it below. Note that the feedback is not anonymous. You can also ask for a reply from the developers.
feedback.responseWanted: I want a reply to the feedback
feedback.supportInfo: If you need help, contact support: <mailTo>{{supportEmail}}</mailTo>

testUse.titleV2: The new chat view is still in development. You can set it as your default if you wish.
testUse.titleV1: This is the old chat view. You've selected the new view as default but can restore the old default here:

sendPreferenceConfigurator.canChangeInSettings: You can change the send keyboard shortcut in chat settings.
sendPreferenceConfigurator.title: What key combination would you like to use to send a message?
sendPreferenceConfigurator.openConfigurator: Keyboard shortcut for sending a message

rag.name: Name
rag.creatorGuide: A RAG index is a collection of documents that are indexed for semantic search and retrieval. Students may activate it in the course chat, which gives the LLM a tool to retrieve relevant information from the index based on a query which it will base its response on. The index name, description and language are especially important as the LLM will use them to decide when to search the index and how to formulate the search query.
rag.nameHelperText: Use a descriptive name (for example the full name of the course)
rag.searchDescription: With this search tool you can test what kind of search results the language model will receive when it uses the document_search-tool. This search is only for testing.
rag.waitForUpload: Please wait, uploading files to the server
rag.filesIngesting: Processing files. You can leave the page.
rag.readMoreAboutRag: Read more about CurreChat's source material feature

embeddedLogin.helpText: Successfully logged in. You may close this window.
